comment.author: 11572312@N00
comment._content: from a previous Flickr photo note: Inez Milholland Boissevain (born August 6, 1886 in Brooklyn, New York - November 25, 1916 in Los Angeles) was a suffragist, labor lawyer, World War I correspondent, and public speaker who greatly influenced the women's movement in America.

comment.author: 29079609@N02
comment._content: that's not just any horse, that is a well bred and well cared for animal!

comment.author: 25537552@N03
comment._content: Inés Miholland Boissevain (nacida el 6 de agosto de 1886 en Brooklyn, Nueva York, muerta el 25 de noviembre de 1916 en Los Ángeles), fue una sufragista, abogada laboralista,corresponsal de la Primera Guerra Mundial y oradora que tuvo gran influencia en el movimiento por los derechos de la mujer en América.

comment.author: 35234565@N04
comment._content: Thanks, Harry Angstrom, for the useful information about Inez Milholland Boissevain.  We will add the clarification of her name, the event (a suffrage parade), and the date to this record next time we update it.
